author: Robert McMillan
title: Apple to Start Putting Sensitive Encryption Keys in China - WSJ
text:
When Apple Inc. next week begins shifting the iCloud accounts of its China-based customers to a local partnerâ€™s servers, it also will take an unprecedented step for the company that alarms some privacy specialists: storing the encryption keys for those accounts in China.

The keys are complex strings of random characters that can unlock the photos, notes and messages that users store in iCloud. Until now, Apple has stored the codes only in the U.S. for all global users, the company said, in keeping with its emphasis on customer... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
